meanings.definition: A box or tray in which outgoing mail is placed.
meanings.sent1: I put my letter in the outbox at the post office.
meanings.sent2: The outbox on my desk is full of envelopes.
meanings.sent3: The outbox was so full, it looked like a colorful stack of papers.
meanings.sent4: Her outbox overflowed with letters, like a waterfall of mail.
meanings.sent5: The outbox, a container for outgoing mail, sat by the door.

meanings.definition: The collection of messages waiting to be sent in an email program.
meanings.sent1: I checked my outbox to see if my emails were ready to send.
meanings.sent2: The outbox in my email app shows all my unsent messages.
meanings.sent3: His outbox was like a digital queue of messages waiting for their turn.
meanings.sent4: The outbox was a virtual holding area for messages, like a digital mailbox.
meanings.sent5: In the outbox, emails patiently waited to be sent.

meanings.definition: To move a message from the outbox to the sent folder.
meanings.sent1: I outbox my emails once I'm sure they're ready to go.
meanings.sent2: Remember to outbox your messages after composing them.
meanings.sent3: She outboxes her emails with a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: He outboxes his messages swiftly, like a digital courier.
meanings.sent5: Outboxing emails is a crucial step before they are officially sent.
